Publication_1: de Jong, J. 1970-1971. Pollen and 14C Analysis of Holocene Deposits in Zijderveld and Environs. Berichten van de Rijksdienst voor het Oudheidkundig Bodemonderzoek 20-21:75-88.

Site_Description: Coastal cliffs. Physiography: ice complex deposit with peat lenses. Surrounding vegetation: tundra.
Publication_1: Andreev, A., Schirrmeister, L., Siegert, C., Bobrov, A.A., Demske, D., Seiffert, M. and Hubberten, H.W., 2002. Paleoenvironmental changes in Northeastern Siberia during the Late Quaternary-evidence from pollen records of the Bykovsky Peninsula. Polarforschung, 70, pp.13-25.
Publication_2: Rachold, V., and M.N. Grigoriev. 1999. Russian-German Cooperation System Laptev Sea 2000. The Lena Delta 1998 Epedition. Berichte zur Polarforschung 315:1-260.

Site_Description: Bog. Physiography: depression in volcanic bedrock. Surrounding vegetation: prairies and forests of Fagus and Abies.
Publication_1: de Beaulieu, J.L., Pons, A. and Reille, M., 1982. Recherches pollenanalytiques sur l'histoire de la végétation de la bordure nord du Massif du Cantal (Massif Central, France). Pollen et Spores, 24(2), pp.251-300.

Site_Description: Bog. Physiography: depression in volcanic bedrock. Surrounding vegetation: prairies and forests of Fagus and Abies.
Publication_1: de Beaulieu, J.L., Pons, A. and Reille, M., 1982. Recherches pollenanalytiques sur l'histoire de la végétation de la bordure nord du Massif du Cantal (Massif Central, France). Pollen et Spores, 24(2), pp.251-300.

Site_Description: Lake. Physiography: depression in the slope of Timan Ridge. Surrounding vegetation: mire & boreal forest dominated by spruce.
Publication_1: Henriksen, M., Mangerud, J.A.N., Matiouchkov, A., Murray, A.S., Paus, A. and Svendsen, J.I., 2008. Intriguing climatic shifts in a 90 kyr old lake record from northern Russia. Boreas, 37(1), pp.20-37.

Site_Description: Lake. Physiography: depression. Surrounding vegetation: dwarf-shrub tundra.
Publication_1: Paus, A., 2021. Lake Heimtjønna at Dovre, Mid-Norway, reveals remarkable late-glacial and Holocene sedimentary environments and the early establishment of spruce (Picea abies), alder (Alnus cf. incana), and alpine plants with present centric distributions. Quaternary International, 580, pp.38-52.

Site_Description: A core taken from a Dobbe near the edge of the Hunzedal.
Publication_1: Hoek, W.Z. 1997. Palaeogeography of lateglacial vegetations. Doctoral dissertation. Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
Publication_2: Hoek, W.Z. 1997. Atlas to Palaeogeography of Lateglacial Vegetations. Doctoral dissertation. Vrije Universiteit, Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, The Netherlands.
Publication_3: De Smet, L.A.H. and Klungel, A.E., 1965. De ouderdom van veenpaketten en gliedelagen in de Groninger Veenkoloniën. Boor en Spade, 14, pp.28-41.

Site_Description: Lake. Physiography: depression in Mt Finnsho. Surrounding vegetation: lichen dominated dwarf-shrub tundra.
Publication_1: Paus, A. and Haugland, V., 2017. Early-to mid-Holocene forest-line and climate dynamics in southern Scandes mountains inferred from contrasting megafossil and pollen data. The Holocene, 27(3), pp.361-383.
Publication_2: Paus, A., Haflidason, H., Routh, J., Naafs, B.D.A. and Thoen, M.W., 2019. Environmental responses to the 9.7 and 8.2 cold events at two ecotonal sites in the Dovre mountains, mid-Norway. Quaternary Science Reviews, 205, pp.45-61.
Publication_3: Paus, A., Boessenkool, S., Brochmann, C., Epp, L.S., Fabel, D., Haflidason, H. and Linge, H., 2015. Lake Store Finnsjøen–a key for understanding Lateglacial/early Holocene vegetation and ice sheet dynamics in the central Scandes Mountains. Quaternary Science Reviews, 121, pp.36-51.

Site_Description: Bog. Physiography: depression. Surrounding vegetation: grassland.
Publication_1: Paus, A., 1990. Late Weichselian and early Holocene vegetation, climate, and floral migration at Utsira, North-Rogaland, southwestern Norway. Norsk Geologisk Tidsskrift, 70(3), pp.135-152.

Site_Description: Fen area near the eastern edge of an extensive mire about 1 km in diameter on the western shore of the Yanakie Isthmus.
Publication_1: Hope, G.S., 1974. The vegetation history from 6000 BP to present of Wilsons Promontory, Victoria, Australia. New Phytologist, 73(5), pp.1035-1053.

Site_Description: Bog. Physiography: depression in flat area. Surrounding vegetation: birch-forest.
Publication_1: Paus, A. and Haugland, V., 2017. Early-to mid-Holocene forest-line and climate dynamics in southern Scandes mountains inferred from contrasting megafossil and pollen data. The Holocene, 27(3), pp.361-383.

Site_Description: Bog in Karmoy island. Physiography: basin in undulating area. Surrounding vegetation: Calluna, Erica, Polytricium, Eriophorum.
Publication_1: Paus, A., 1989. Late Weichselian vegetation, climate, and floral migration at Liastemmen, North Rogaland, south‐western Norway. Journal of Quaternary Science, 4(3), pp.223-242.

Site_Description: The peats represent fresh water swamps presumably created when a beach ridge blocked off past seaward extensions of the calcareninte dunes and the drainage into such swamps was very restricted. The site is covered at high tide and supports no vegetation at the present. Dunes behind the beach and calcarenite cliffs are covered by low open shrublands of the composites Calocephalus brozvnii, Olearia axillaris and Helichrysum spp. with Leptospermum laevigatum and pioneer grasses and herbs.
Publication_1: Hope, G.S., 1974. The vegetation history from 6000 BP to present of Wilsons Promontory, Victoria, Australia. New Phytologist, 73(5), pp.1035-1053.

Site_Description: The island is part of the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area and is situated northeast of the Australian mainland coast. Aprroximately 60% of the island is covered by grassland. Smaller patches are vegetated by closed forest (or rainforest), low closed forest (or semi-deciduous notophyll vine forest), closed shrub forest and heathland. Mangoves are also found several places along the coast of the island.
Publication_1: Proske, U. and Haberle, S.G., 2012. Island ecosystem and biodiversity dynamics in northeastern Australia during the Holocene: Unravelling short-term impacts and long-term drivers. The Holocene, 22(10), pp.1097-1111.

Site_Description: Bog. Physiography: fluvial system. Surrounding vegetation: agriculture and industry.
Publication_1: Paus, A., 1989. Late Weichselian vegetation, climate and floral migration at Eigebakken, South Rogaland, southwestern Norway. Review of Palaeobotany and Palynology, 61(3-4), pp.177-203.

Site_Description: Bog. Physiography: Roros mountains. Surrounding vegetation: grasses.
Publication_1: Paus, A. and Haugland, V., 2017. Early-to mid-Holocene forest-line and climate dynamics in southern Scandes mountains inferred from contrasting megafossil and pollen data. The Holocene, 27(3), pp.361-383.

Site_Description: The VM375 core site is located in the Attawapiskat River watershed in the Hudson Plains Ecozone of Canada, and is situated in an expansive complex of contiguous bogs and fens. The dominant bog vegetation at the coring site consists of Sphagnum fuscum, as well as woody vegetation, primarily Picea mariana.
Publication_1: Da Silva, K.A., Snyder, R.A., Packalen, M.S., McLaughlin, J.W., Peteet, D.M. and Finkelstein, S.A., 2022. Mineral inputs, paleoecological change, and Holocene carbon accumulation at a boreal peatland in the Hudson Bay Lowlands, Canada. Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology, Palaeoecology, 596, p.110996.

Site_Description: Bog in slope. Physiography: glacial origine. Surrounding vegetation: forest.
Publication_1: Mangerud, J., Birks, H.H., Halvorsen, L.S., Hughes, A.L., Nashoug, O., Nystuen, J.P., Paus, A., Sørensen, R. and Svendsen, J.I., 2018. The timing of deglaciation and the sequence of pioneer vegetation at Ringsaker, eastern Norway–and an earthquake-triggered landslide. Norsk Geologisk Tidsskrift, 98(3), pp.301-318.

Site_Description: The major vegetation surrounding the site is Eucalyptus pauciflora-E. dalrympleana dominated open forest. The understorey is scattered Acacia spp., with Poa sieberana grassland. An ecotone of E. stellulata fringes the swamp. The swamp consists largely of Sphagnum hummock/hollow vegetation.
Publication_1: Dodson, J.R., 1987. Mire development and environmental change, Barrington Tops, New South Wales, Australia. Quaternary Research, 27(1), pp.73-81.
Publication_2: Dodson, J.R., Greenwood, P.W. and Jones, R.L., 1986. Holocene forest and wetland vegetation dynamics at Barrington Tops, New South Wales. Journal of Biogeography, pp.561-585.

Site_Description: The Tiam point rests at an outporing of a predominatly seasonal creek system, where it enters the head of a tidal mangrove community. The swamp is covered with Sporobolus virginicus and patches of Acrostichum aureum. Stands of Pandanus and Melaleuca species fringe the landward swamp side and expand into a sparse eucalypt woodland across the surrounding cathcment slopes. Seawards, mangroves prevail.
Publication_1: Rowe, C., 2007. A palynological investigation of Holocene vegetation change in Torres Strait, seasonal tropics of northern Australia. Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology, Palaeoecology, 251(1), pp.83-103.
Publication_2: Rowe, C., 2007. Vegetation change following mid-Holocene marine transgression of the Torres Strait shelf: a record from the island of Mua, northern Australia. The Holocene, 17(7), pp.927-937.

Site_Description: Waruid is the local Badu Islander name for the northern sector of the Badu island. Waruidcontains an extensive mangrove community along its northern coastline. An open, low energy coastal environment is occupied by a dense seaward stand of Rhizophora spp. in which other taxa are infrequent. Landward, species of Ceriops and Avicennia dominate over Rhizophora. At the core site a saline mudflat maintains only a sporadic cover of vegetation.
Publication_1: Rowe, C., 2007. A palynological investigation of Holocene vegetation change in Torres Strait, seasonal tropics of northern Australia. Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology, Palaeoecology, 251(1), pp.83-103.

Site_Description: The forest lies in the transition between the boreal and temperate zones and contains several tree species at the limit of their distribution. It is composed of a mosaic of diverse forest communities, principally oak-lime-hornbeam (Tilio-Carpinetum) and pine-spruce-oak(Pino-Quercetum).
Publication_1: Mitchell, F.J. and Cole, E., 1998. Reconstruction of long‐term successional dynamics of temperate woodland in Białowieża Forest, Poland. Journal of Ecology, 86(6), pp.1042-1059.

Site_Description: Spring. Surrounding vegetation: Plain Bushveld. Publication does not list any substantial hiatuses, but a potential hiatus could be inferred from the chronology between 23,000 and 20,000 BP
Publication_1: Scott, L., Holmgren, K., Talma, A.S., Woodborne, S. and Vogel, J.C., 2003. Age interpretation of the Wonderkrater spring sediments and vegetation change in the Savanna Biome, Limpopo province, South Africa. South African Journal of Science, 99(9), pp.484-488.

Site_Description: Ancient lake in wetland. Physiography: Coastal plain in tectonic depression. Surrounding vegetation: Olea, Pistacia, Quercus coccifera.
Publication_1: Katrantsiotis, C., Norström, E., Smittenberg, R.H., Finne, M., Weiberg, E., Hättestrand, M., Avramidis, P. and Wastegård, S., 2019. Climate changes in the Eastern Mediterranean over the last 5000 years and their links to the high-latitude atmospheric patterns and Asian monsoons. Global and planetary change, 175, pp.36-51.

Site_Description: An extensive swampy area forms the estuary of Tidal River, a small stream which drains west from the central hills into Norman Bay. Beach dunes have formed a bar across the mouth of the stream and a flat, low lying area (of about 3 km^2) of peaty soils has built up behind these. The calcareous beach dunes support L. laevigatum shrub-lands with emergent trees of Banksia integrifolia and Casuarina stricta.
Publication_1: Hope, G.S., 1974. The vegetation history from 6000 BP to present of Wilsons Promontory, Victoria, Australia. New Phytologist, 73(5), pp.1035-1053.

Site_Description: The lake is mostly dry but is subject to transient seasonal flooding from local rainfall and occasional runoff from catchments arising in ranges to the west. Vegetation in the region is sparse, low and very open.
Publication_1: Singh, G. and Luly, J., 1991. Changes in vegetation and seasonal climate since the last full glacial at Lake Frome, South Australia. Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology, Palaeoecology, 84(1-4), pp.75-86.
Publication_2: Bowler, J.M., Qi, H., Kezao, C., Head, M.J. and Baoyin, Y., 1986. Radiocarbon dating of playa-lake hydrologic changes: examples from northwestern China and central Australia. Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology, Palaeoecology, 54(1-4), pp.241-260.
Publication_3: Luly, J.G., 2001. On the equivocal fate of late Pleistocene Callitris Vent.(Cupressaceae) woodlands in arid south Australia. Quaternary International, 83, pp.155-168.
Publication_4: Luly, J. and Jacobson, G., 2000. Two new AMS radiocarbon dates from Lake Frome, arid South Australia. Quaternary Australasia, 18(1), pp.29-33.

Site_Description: Gulf of Carpentaria is a shallow sea between Northern Australia and Papua New Guinea. During the quaternary, the Carpentaria basin was exposed and contained a shallow, brackish lake.
Publication_1: Torgersen, T., Luly, J., De Deckker, P., Jones, M.R., Searle, D.E., Chivas, A.R. and Ullman, W.J., 1988. Late Quaternary environments of the Carpentaria basin, Australia. Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology, Palaeoecology, 67(3-4), pp.245-261.

Site_Description: Several cores conaining clay and peat were collected from the North Sea, from the Northern Part of the Netherlands.
Publication_1: Hoek, W.Z. 1997. Palaeogeography of lateglacial vegetations. Doctoral dissertation. Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
Publication_2: Hoek, W.Z. 1997. Atlas to Palaeogeography of Lateglacial Vegetations. Doctoral dissertation. Vrije Universiteit, Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, The Netherlands.
Publication_3: Zagwijn, W.H. and De Jong, J., 1969. Pollenanalytisch onderzoek van een aantal kernen en grijpmonsters van de Noordzee. Rijks Geologische Dienst Afdelning Palaeobotanie Haarlem, Intern Rapport, 516, pp.1-10.

Site_Description: Lake in a cristal sag.
Publication_1: Beuning, K.R.M. 1997. Late-Gacial and Holocen vegetation, climate and hydrology of lakes Albert and Victoria, East Africa. Unpublished PhD Thesis, University of Minnesota Minnesota, 183p..
Publication_2: Beuning, K.R.M. 1999. A re-evaluation of the late glacial and early-Holocene vegetation history of the Lake Victoria region. Palaeoecology of Africa, 26, pp.115-136..

Site_Description: Mire. Physiography: North slope of Arbarrain summit. Surrounding vegetation: acidophilus beech forests.
Publication_1: Pérez‐Díaz, S., López-Sáez, J.A., de la Fuente, S.N. and Ruiz-Alonso, M., 2018. Early farmers, megalithic builders and the shaping of the cultural landscapes during the Holocene in Northern Iberian mountains. A palaeoenvironmental perspective. Journal of Archaeological Science: Reports, 18, pp.463-474.

Site_Description: Bog. Physiography: Basin of the Ason river. Surrounding vegetation: herb.
Publication_1: Pérez‐Díaz, S., Núñez de la Fuente, S., Frochoso Sánchez, M., González Pellejero, R., Allende Álvarez, F. and JA, L.S., 2016. Seis mil años de gestión y dinámica antrópica en el entorno del Parque Natural de los Collados del Asón (Cordillera Cantábrica Oriental).

Site_Description: Blanket bog. Physiography: in the peak of mountain. Surrounding vegetation: pasture.
Publication_1: Pérez‐Díaz, S., López‐Sáez, J.A., Pontevedra‐Pombal, X., Souto‐Souto, M. and Galop, D., 2016. 8000 years of vegetation history in the northern Iberian Peninsula inferred from the palaeoenvironmental study of the Zalama ombrotrophic bog (Basque‐Cantabrian Mountains, Spain). Boreas, 45(4), pp.658-672.

Site_Description: Little bog. Physiography: depression. Surrounding vegetation: forest and cultivated fields.
Publication_1: Rosch, M. 2020. Ein Pollenprofil aus dem Moor am Durchenberg, Stadt Rodolfzell, Landkreis Konstanz. Fundberichte aus Baden-Wurttemberg 40:37-48.

Site_Description: A core taken from the infill of an abandoned branch of the small river Vlootbeek, a tributary of the river Meuse.
Publication_1: Bakels, C., 2017. Posterholt, a Late Pleistocene–Holocene record of the vegetation history in and around the valley of the Vlootbeek, a tributary of the river Meuse (southeastern Netherlands). Netherlands Journal of Geosciences, 96(2), pp.175-182.

Site_Description: A core taken from a former peat bog near the city of Sittard, which has been taken during a construction-project in the Jublieumstraat. The peat bog originate from a dried up part of the small river Geleenbeek.
Publication_1: Bakels, C., 2021. De vegetatiegeschiedenis van Sittard aan de hand van een pollendiagram. Natuurhistorisch Maandblad, 110(7), pp.165-172.

Site_Description: A core taken from an abandoned meander of the river Swalm, a relatively small triburaty of the river Meuse near the village Swalmen.
Publication_1: Bakels, C., 2017. Medieval impacts on the vegetation around the confluence of the river Meuse and its tributary the Swalm, the Netherlands. Netherlands Journal of Geosciences, 96(2), pp.165-173.
Publication_2: Bakels, C.C., Langeveld, M. and Tulder, I.V., 2015. Clearance for a medieval curtis, Black Death and buckwheat (Fagopyrum esculentum Moench): vegetation history of the area around the confluence of the rivers Swalm and Meuse, the Netherlands, AD 800-1900. Analecta Praehistorica Leidensia, 45, pp.123 - 131.

Site_Description: A core taken from a filled-in oxbow of the river Meuse near the farm Syperhof.
Publication_1: Bakels, C., 2017. Medieval impacts on the vegetation around the confluence of the river Meuse and its tributary the Swalm, the Netherlands. Netherlands Journal of Geosciences, 96(2), pp.165-173.
Publication_2: Bakels, C.C., Langeveld, M. and Tulder, I.V., 2015. Clearance for a medieval curtis, Black Death and buckwheat (Fagopyrum esculentum Moench): vegetation history of the area around the confluence of the rivers Swalm and Meuse, the Netherlands, AD 800-1900. Analecta Praehistorica Leidensia, 45, pp.123 - 131.

Site_Description: Lake Victoria, Pilkington Bay
Publication_1: Taylor, D. and Robertshaw, P., 2001. Sedimentary sequences in western Uganda as. In Palaeoecology of Africa and the Surrounding Islands: Proceedings of the 25th Inqua Conference, Durban, South Africa, 3-11 August 1999 (Vol. 27, p. 63). CRC Press.
Publication_2: Kendall, R.L., 1969. An ecological history of the Lake Victoria basin. Ecological Monographs, 39(2), pp.121-176.

Site_Description: A core taken near an acheological site which lies on the bank of an ancient channel of the river Meuse.
Publication_1: Bakels, C.C., Fokkens, H., Coles, B., Gijn, A.V., Kleijne, J., Ponjee, H. and Slappendel, C., 2008. Maastricht-Vogelzang, the Netherlands, a Michelsberg site in the valley of the Meuse seen from a botanical angle. Between Foraging and Farming, (40), pp.111-123.

Site_Description: Backswamp deposit in the province of Utrecht, in the central part of the Netherlands. Pollen analysis & C14-dating.
Publication_1: Hoek, W.Z. 1997. Palaeogeography of lateglacial vegetations. Doctoral dissertation. Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
Publication_2: Hoek, W.Z. 1997. Atlas to Palaeogeography of Lateglacial Vegetations. Doctoral dissertation. Vrije Universiteit, Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, The Netherlands.
Publication_3: De Jong, J. 1980. Uitkomsten van C14-ouderdomsbepalingen aan een boring bij Polsbroek. Rapport 885. Rijks Geologische Dienst.
Publication_4: De Jong, J. 1989. Pollenanalytisch onderzoek van afzettingen uit het Holoceen en Laatglaciaal in een boring bij Polsbroek. Rapport 1080. Rijks Geologische Dienst.

Site_Description: A core from a \komkleigebied\ inbetween Horssen en Molenhoek in the Land van Maas en Waal.
Publication_1: Teunissen, D., 1990. Palynologisch onderzoek in het oostelijk rivierengebied. Een overzicht. Mededelingen van de afdeling Biogeologie van de Discipline Biologie, 16.
Publication_2: Karg, S., Joop, K.A., Meurers-Balke, J., Teunissen-van Oorschot, H. and Müller, M., 2008. Mensch und Vegetation am unteren Niederrhein während der Eisen-und Römerzeit. In Colonia Ulpia Traiana: Xanten und sein Umland in römischer Zeit (pp. 31-48). Philipp von Zabern.

Site_Description: Terrace. Grasslands dominated by Themeda triandra, Festuca costa, F. scabra and Elionurus mutica. Along streams, Cyperus marginatus and Phragmites australis occur. Monocymbium ceresiiforme-Tristachya leucothrix grassland.
Publication_1: Scott, L., Bousman, C.B. and Nyakale, M., 2005. Holocene pollen from swamp, cave and hyrax dung deposits at Blydefontein (Kikvorsberge), Karoo, South Africa. Quaternary International, 129(1), pp.49-59.
Publication_2: Nyakale, M., 1999. Palynology of Late Quaternary deposits from the central plateau, South Africa. Doctoral dissertation. University of the Free State, Bloemfontein, South Africa.

Site_Description: Sahelian wooded grassland. Interdunal depression. Array of plant communities that include an azonal extension north of Guinean humid forests and Sudanian dry forests and wooded grasslands
Publication_1: Lemonnier, K. and Lézine, A.M., 2021. Timing and nature of the end of the African Humid Period in the Sahel: Insight from pollen data. In Quaternary Vegetation Dynamics–The African Pollen Database (pp. 51-64). CRC Press.
Publication_2: Lézine, A.M., Lemonnier, K. and Fofana, C.A.K., 2019. Sahel environmental variability during the last millennium: Insight from a pollen, charcoal and algae record from the Niayes area, Senegal. Review of Palaeobotany and Palynology, 271, p.104103.

Site_Description: A core taken at the border of an archeological settlement from a silted up oxbow lake.
Publication_1: Bakels, C.C., 1993. Botanische Untersuchungen in der Rössener Siedlung Maastricht-Randwijck uit 7000 Jahre bäuerliche Landschaft. Archäophysika, 13, pp.35-48.

Site_Description: A core taken in 1993 by the Rijks Geologische Dienst in the Maasdal north of the village Oss. The core has been reanalysed and dated in 1999.
Publication_1: Bakels, C.C. 1999. Het pollendiagram Oss 45E/346. Pages 259 - 270 in H. Fokkens and R. Jansen, editors. 2000 jaar bewoningsdynamiek. Brons- en ijzertijdbewoning in het Maas-Demer-Scheldegebied. The Netherlands.

Site_Description: Mosaic of wooded grasslands, dry deciduous and riverine forests, and mangroves that grow near estuaries. Dry deciduous forest dominated by Didiereaceae, Adansonia fony, Euphorbia spp., and Pachypodium geayi
Publication_1: Domic AI, Hixon SW, Velez MI, Ivory SJ, Douglass KG, Brenner M, Curtis JH, Culleton BJ and Kennett DJ (2021) Influence of Late Holocene Climate Change and Human Land Use on Terrestrial and Aquatic Ecosystems in Southwest Madagascar. Frontiers in Ecology and Evolution, 9, p.688512.

Site_Description: Several cores conaining clay and peat were collected from the North Sea, from the Northern Part of the Netherlands.
Publication_1: Hoek, W.Z. 1997. Palaeogeography of lateglacial vegetations. Doctoral dissertation. Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
Publication_2: Hoek, W.Z. 1997. Atlas to Palaeogeography of Lateglacial Vegetations. Doctoral dissertation. Vrije Universiteit, Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, The Netherlands.
Publication_3: Zagwijn, W.H. and De Jong, J., 1969. Pollenanalytisch onderzoek van een aantal kernen en grijpmonsters van de Noordzee. Rijks Geologische Dienst Afdelning Palaeobotanie Haarlem, Intern Rapport, 516, pp.1-10.

Site_Description: Mid-elevation poor fen, with a small amount of surface flow connecting it to nearby wetlands and Anderson Lake. Surface plant cover is dominted by Sphagnum spp. and sedges.
Publication_1: Lacourse, T., Adeleye, M.A. and Stewart, J.R., 2019. Peatland formation, succession and carbon accumulation at a mid-elevation poor fen in Pacific Canada. The Holocene, 29(11), pp.1694-1707.
Publication_2: Lacourse, T., and M.A. Adeleye. 2022. Climate and species traits drive changes in Holocene forest composition along an elevation gradient in Pacific Canada. Frontiers in Ecology and Evolution, 10, pp.838545.

Site_Description: Oasis located 700 m east of the Dead Sea shore (northern basin)
Publication_1: Eggenberger, S., Gobet, E., van Leeuwen, J.F., Schwörer, C., van der Knaap, W.O., van Dobben, H.F., Vogel, H., Tinner, W. and Rambeau, C., 2018. Millennial multi-proxy reconstruction of oasis dynamics in Jordan, by the Dead Sea. Vegetation History and Archaeobotany, 27(5), pp.649-664.

Site_Description: Samples taken from a peatland near the village of Vinkeveen.
Publication_1: NA

Site_Description: Peat riverine in plateau. Physiography: steep slope from alluvial plain (Senne). Surrounding vegetation: center town.
Publication_1: Marinova, E., Devos, Y., Speleers, L. and Modrie, S., 2022. 59. The peat profile of Rue des Boîteux–Rue d’Argent (BR295), Senne valley, Brussels (Belgium). Grana, pp.1-3.

Site_Description: Mire. Physiography: depression. Surrounding vegetation: Dry sagebrush-grass steppe & halophytes.
Publication_1: Ryabogina, N.E., Idrisov, I.A., Yuzhanina, E.D. and Borisov, A.V., 2022. Peat palaeorecords from the arid Caspian Lowland in Russia: Environmental and anthropogenic effects during the second half of the Holocene. Quaternary Science Reviews, 280, p.107417.

Site_Description: Remnant forest and woodland is present, representing climax forest types, Hagenia abyssinica, Pittosporum goetzei, Juniperus procea, Teclea simplicifolia and Nuxia congesta. Fire-resistant pioneering species, such as Crotalaria agatiflora and Gnidia glauca, are found in distubed areas
Publication_1: Ryner, M.A., Bonnefille, R., Holmgren, K. and Muzuka, A., 2006. Vegetation changes in Empakaai Crater, northern Tanzania, at 14,800–9300 cal yr BP. Review of Palaeobotany and Palynology, 140(3-4), pp.163-174.

Site_Description: Mire. Physiography: depression in upland. Surrounding vegetation: wormwood-grass steppe with sparse shrubs.
Publication_1: Ryabogina, N.E., Idrisov, I.A., Yuzhanina, E.D. and Borisov, A.V., 2022. Peat palaeorecords from the arid Caspian Lowland in Russia: Environmental and anthropogenic effects during the second half of the Holocene. Quaternary Science Reviews, 280, p.107417.

Site_Description: Avery Lake is a swale lake located in southern Illinois on a portion of the Ohio River floodplain referred to as the Black Bottom. The Black Bottom is believed to have formed over the last 10,000-20,000 years as the Ohio River gradually meandered southward, depositing sediments on the north bank of the river.
Publication_1: Bird, B.W., Barr, R.C., Commerford, J., Gilhooly III, W.P., Wilson, J.J., Finney, B., McLauchlan, K. and Monaghan, G.W., 2019. Late-Holocene floodplain development, land-use, and hydroclimate–flood relationships on the lower Ohio River, US. The Holocene, 29(12), pp.1856-1870.
Publication_2: Commerford, J.L., Gittens, G., Gainforth, S., Wilson, J.J. and Bird, B.W., 2022. Differences in forest composition following two periods of settlement by pre-Columbian Native Americans. Vegetation History and Archaeobotany, pp.1-14.

Site_Description: Morro Bay is an estuary located on the central CA coast, separated by a sandspit from Estero Bay and the Pacific Ocean, bounded on its eastern edge by the Morro Bay salt marsh. Surrounding vegetation: The Morro Bay salt marsh is dominated by Salicornia and sedges, while flora on the neighboring coastal dune ecostystem includes herbs, shrubs, and succulents. The hills of the Morro Bay watershed are home to native and non-native grassland plants. Chaparral and coastal scrub lie along steep slopes, while riparian woodland dominated by California live oak occupies small valley tributaries.
Publication_1: Broadman, E., Reidy, L. and Wahl, D., 2022. Late Holocene human-environment interactions on the central California coast, USA, inferred from Morro Bay salt marsh sediments. Anthropocene, 38, p.100339.

Site_Description: Amboseli basin, north of Kilimanjaro. Massive organic silty gyttja, low organic content at base
Publication_1: Githumbi, E.N., Kariuki, R., Shoemaker, A., Courtney-Mustaphi, C.J., Chuhilla, M., Richer, S., Lane, P. and Marchant, R., 2018. Pollen, people and place: multidisciplinary perspectives on ecosystem change at Amboseli, Kenya. Frontiers in Earth Science, 5, p.113.

Site_Description: Large peatbog. Physiography: hilly area in upland. Surrounding vegetation: Picea and Pinus forest.

Site_Description: Bog. Physiography: hummocky landscape. Surrounding vegetation: Picea, Fagus forest, agriculture land.

Site_Description: Monodominant forest occurs that is characterized by the high abundance of the shade-tolerant tree Gilbertiodendron dewevrei
Publication_1: Tovar, C., Harris, D.J., Breman, E., Brncic, T. and Willis, K.J., 2019. Tropical monodominant forest resilience to climate change in Central Africa: A Gilbertiodendron dewevrei forest pollen record over the past 2,700 years. Journal of vegetation science, 30(3), pp.575-586.

Site_Description: Lago del Pesce is a mountain pond in the Pollino National Park (Basilicata, Italy). The site is partially surrounded by a dense European beech (Fagus sylvatica L.) forest that is interrupted toward the east by a grassland with scattered trees. There is no riparian forest along the lakeshore. The water body and the forest edge are separated by a band of Cyperaceae. The geological substrate is mainly composed of flysch.
Publication_1: NA

Site_Description: Savanna biome, regionally recognized as the semi-arid Eastern Kalahari Busheveld bioregion and locally classified as the Kathu Bushveld
Publication_1: Sobol, M.K., Chazan, M., Scott, L. and Finkelstein, S.A., 2022. Characterizing the Meghalayan Stage in southern Africa: A multiproxy record of paleoenvironmental change at the southern margin of the Kalahari. Quaternary International, 614, pp.98-110.

Site_Description: Sahel Acacia wooded grassland zone. woody spiny species of Mimosaceae (A. seyal, A. sieberiana, A. nilotica, Faidherbia albida) and Capparidaceae (Maerua crassifolia, Boscia senegalensis, Capparis decidua), associated with Leptadenia pyrotechnica, Salvadora persica, Commiphora africana and Balanites aegyptiaca.

Publication_1: Muiruri, V. M. 2008. Detecting environmental change and anthropogenic activities on Laikipia Plateau, Kenya. Doctoral dissertation. University of the Free State, Bloemfontein, South Africa.

Site_Description: The site is located near the confluence of the Iset River and the Tobol.The settlement Oskino Boloto with cultural layers and structures from the Neolithic to the Middle Ages was investigated on the ledge of the terrace near the Oskino-09 swamp. Oskino-09 occupies an oval-shaped basin with an area of about 70 hectares on the edge of the high left-bank terrace. The outer parts of the swamp are flooded and covered with reeds, cotton grass and cattail. The northwestern part of the basin is occupied by an ombrotrophic bog with birch and oppressed pine. However, the southeastern part of the basin is deeper, mesotrophic peat accumulation is still taking place here, the area is almost treeless and covered with horsetail vegetation, with reeds, an admixture of butterbur and rare willow bushes. The drilling and sampling site was in this part of the wetland.
Publication_1: Yuzhanina, E., N. Ryabogina, A. Afonin, S.N. Ivanov, and A.A. Tkachev. 2019. Vegetation and climate of the Iset-Tobol interfluve from the eneolithic to the early iron age: new palaeoecological data on the Oskino-09 swamp. Vestnik Arheologii, Antropologii i Etnografii, 4(47), pp.15-27.

Site_Description: The lake was dry when coring was undertaken. When full, extensive beds of red milfoil spread over the western half of the lake.
Publication_1: Mills, K., P. Gell, and A.P. Kershaw. 2013. The Recent Victorian Drought and its Impact. Without precedent?. 12/040, Rural Industries Research and Development Corporation, Barton, Australian Capital Territory, Australia.

Site_Description: The land is primarilly made up of Quatermary Lavas and pyroclasticis. "Aluaipugua is a small cyperaceous swamp at 2750 m surrounded by grassland with upper montane forest nearby. The swamp is about 500 m long by 250 m wide on the headwaters of a small stream flowing to the east eventually into the Margarima River. The present-swamp vegetation is dominated by Juncus and Machaerina with Hypericum and some ferns common throughout."-(Haberle, 1993)
Publication_1: Haberle, S.G. 1993. Late Quaternary Environmental History of the Tari Basin, Papua New Guinea. Doctoral dissertation. Australian National University, Canberra, Australia.

Publication_3: van Leeuwen, J.F. and van der Knaap, W.O., 2008. 3. Fleck's Loch Bog (Foula, Shetland, Scotland, UK). Grana, 47(2), pp.171-173.

Site_Description: Kettle lake with floating sedge mat. Physiography: Bighorn Mountains. Surrounding vegetation: lodgepole pine forest.
Publication_1: Burkart, M.R., 1976. Pollen biostratigraphy and late Quaternary vegetation history of the Bighorn Mountains, Wyoming. Doctoral dissertation. University of Iowa, Iowa City, Iowa, USA.

Site_Description: Lake Ann is a scour basin in the spillway of a proglacial lake. Surrounding vegetation: Old-growth forest. Steep slopes to the S and SW of the coring site comprise hemlock and hemlock/hardwoods forest. Gentler slopes N and NE of the coring sites comprise hemlock/northern hardwoods and white pine/red pine/red oak forest. Coring sites were selected to maximize macrofossil influx from slopes to the south.
Publication_1: Andersen, J.S. 2005. Patterns of Lake Holocene invasion of yellow birch in central Upper Michigan: A new record from the Huron Mountains. Master's thesis. University of Wyoming, Laramie, Wyoming, USA.

Site_Description: Archaeological site. Physiography: Former marshland in coastal plain. Surrounding vegetation: cultivated fields, olive agriculture.
